title: Automating Human Tutor-Style Programming Feedback: Leveraging GPT-4 Tutor Model for Hint Generation and GPT-3.5 Student Model for Hint Validation. (arXiv:2310.03780v1 [cs.AI])
abstract: Generative AI and large language models hold great promise in enhancing programming education by automatically generating individualized feedback for students. We investigate the role of generative AI models in providing human tutor-style programming hints to help students resolve errors in their buggy programs. Recent works have benchmarked state-of-the-art models for various feedback generation scenarios; however, their overall quality is still inferior to human tutors and not yet ready for real-world deployment. In this paper, we seek to push the limits of generative AI models toward providing high-quality programming hints and develop a novel technique, GPT4Hints-GPT3.5Val. As a first step, our technique leverages GPT-4 as a ``tutor'' model to generate hints -- it boosts the generative quality by using symbolic information of failing test cases and fixes in prompts. As a next step, our technique leverages GPT-3.5, a weaker model, as a ``student'' model to further validate the hint

translated_title: 自动化人工导师式编程反馈: 利用GPT-4导师模型生成提示和GPT-3.5学生模型进行提示验证
translated_abstract: 生成式人工智能和大型语言模型在提供个性化编程反馈方面具有巨大潜力。本文研究了生成式人工智能模型在提供人工导师式编程提示方面的作用，以帮助学生解决程序中的错误。然而，最新的研究工作虽然对各种反馈生成场景进行了评估，但其整体质量仍远不及人工导师，并且还没有准备好在实际环境中投入使用。为了提高生成式人工智能模型提供高质量编程提示的能力，我们开发了一种新的技术，名为GPT4Hints-GPT3.5Val。首先，我们的技术利用GPT-4作为“导师”模型生成提示，通过使用失败的测试用例的符号信息和提示中的修复方法，提高了生成质量。接下来，我们的技术利用较弱的GPT-3.5模型作为“学生”模型进一步验证提示的有效性。
tldr: 本文研究了使用生成式人工智能和大型语言模型自动生成个性化编程反馈的方法。通过结合GPT-4作为“导师”模型生成提示，利用失败的测试用例的信息和修复方法，实现了更高质量的生成提示。然后，利用较弱的GPT-3.5模型作为“学生”模型进一步验证提示的有效性。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the use of generative AI and large language models to automatically generate personalized programming feedback. By leveraging GPT-4 as a "tutor" model to generate hints using information from failing test cases and fixes, the quality of generated hints is improved. Then, GPT-3.5 is used as a "student" model to further validate the effectiveness of the hints.
